intro: Gnaphalium capense, commonly known as the Cape bluemouth, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky outcrops. Its small, blue to purple flowers are clustered in dense, spherical heads, giving it a distinctive appearance. Gnaphalium capense is often found in coastal areas and is adapted to withstand harsh environmental conditions.
